Notes: The Center for Puppetry Arts Museum opened in 1978 with a loan of 150 puppets by noted puppetry collector and expert Nancy Lohman Staub (who later donated them to the Center). Since then, the collection has grown to include more than 1,000 puppets and 1,000 posters of historical and cultural significance. The Collection also includes the holdings of the Research Library, which contains over 1,500 books and 1,000 videotapes, as well as photographs, clippings and periodicals documenting puppetry throughout the world.
